repnme.cdata!:
Uruguay - Contractual Savings Structural
            Adjustment Loan Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Overall, the outcome of the project is
            considered highly satisfactory. The principal lessons
            learned in the implementation of the project are: i) In
            preparing complex sector adjustment operations, the Bank
            should lead with its comparative advantage - bringing to
            bear strong technical capacity, honed by practical
            cross-country experience. ii) Political factors and the
            legislative needs of the client need to be understood at
            entry, and should be included in the Bank's dialogue
            with the client. iii) It is important to select an
            appropriate instrument. Rather than risk delays and failure
            in the achievement of the program's long term aims, the
            Bank team chose to negotiate a medium-term reform strategy,
            and to allocate its reform goals over a series of
            single-tranche adjustment operations (STOs). This provided
            the Bank with greater agility in the disbursement, and will
            enhance the institution's efficiency and leverage in
            establishing the conditions of the proposed second loan.

5085889.majtheme: Economic management,Social protection and risk management

repnme.cdata!:
Uruguay - Contractual Savings Adjustment
            Loan Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Contractual Savings Structural
            Adjustment Loan Project for Uruguay supports the development
            of the capitalized system of individual pension accounts,
            established as part of Uruguay's 1996 pension reform.
            Pension reform success depends on the level of pension
            benefits that the capitalization regime can provide its
            affiliates. Good financial performance by the capitalization
            regime would only be achieved if the AFAPs (Pension Fund
            Administrators) are able to invest in relatively high return
            marketable securities and reduce their operating costs. This
            loan supports a number of measures to 1) liberalize the
            investment regime of the AFAPs to allow greater investment
            in private securities; 2) increase the availability of
            private securities to match the growth of capitalized
            pension funds; and 3) create incentives to improve cost
            consciousness among the AFAPs and transparency in reporting.
